properties.name: Adirondack Interpretive Center
properties.description: Managed by SUNY ESF, offers public programs, events, speaker series, courses and other activities directly from ESF faculty, staff members and guest experts

properties.name: Strand Theatre of Old Forge
properties.address: 3093 Rte 28 Main St, Old Forge, NY

properties.name: Wanakena Footbridge,  Cranberry Lake
properties.description: On National  Register of Historic Places, 171 foot suspension bridge

properties.name: View Arts Center
properties.description: Exhibits, Workshops and Performances

properties.name: Sabattis Adventure Camp
properties.description: summer camp

properties.name: Piseco Lake Historical Museum
properties.description: The pre-Civil War Riley House, which dates back to the once thriving tannery and sawmill industry found in the Piseco Lake area, is now home to a local history collection. Open July and August, Fri-Sun

properties.name: Wild Center
properties.description: Offer live animal programs, exhibits, multi-media shows, marked trails, and other indoor and outdoor activities.

properties.name: Adirondack Museum
properties.address: 9097 State Route 30 Blue Mountain Lake, NY 12812
properties.description: Museum about life, work, travel, and activities in the Adirondacks from the 1800's til now.
properties.comments: Open late May til Mid October

properties.name: Indian Lake Museum
properties.description: The museum is housed in one of Indian Lake's earliest homes, built following the Civil War in 1865 by Allen Brooks. The collection paints a picture of early times in Indian Lake with arrowheads, farm tools, vintage clothing, photographs of schools and hotels, portraits of early settlers, scrapbooks, medical equipment from town doctors, oddities and memorabilia. Open mid June-October

properties.name: Adirondack Ecological Center
properties.description: Leader in ecological sciences in the Adirondack Mountains and a major contributor to the science internationally, offers year-round research and instructional programs

properties.name: Adirondack Lakes Center for the Arts Center
properties.description: Gallery, performances

properties.name: Hemlock Ledge Camp
properties.address: 26 Hemlock Ledge Road #3, Tupper Lake, NY 12986

properties.name: White Pine Camp - Paul Smiths
properties.address: 197 White Pine Dr, North Bangor, NY

properties.name: Charles Dickert Wildlife Museum
properties.address: 109 Main Street, Saranac Lake, New York 12983
properties.description: Located in Saranac Lake Free Library, a collection of over 100 different animals from the adirondack region in one of the largest taxidermy creations of taxidermist Charles Dickert
properties.comments: First Floor of the public library, Open year round

properties.name: Pendragon Theatre
properties.address: 15 Brandy Brook Avenue, Saranac Lake, NY
properties.description: year round performance and educational programs

properties.name: Six Nations Indian Museum
properties.address: Cty Route 30, Gabriels Onchiota Rd, Onchiota, NY
properties.description: A unique museum packed with more than 3,000 artifacts with an emphasis on the Six Nations of the Iroquois Confederacy Mohawks, Oneidas, Senecas, Onondagas, Cayugas, Tuscaroras. Open July-Labor Day

properties.name: Lake Placid - North Elba Historical Museum
properties.description: The 1903 Lake Placid train station now serves as a local history museum featuring memorabilia from the 1932 Olympic Winter Games and the Lake Placid Club, early sporting equipment, historic photographs

properties.name: North Creek Railway Depot Museum
properties.description: Historic building, exhibits, programs

properties.name: Camp Santanoni
properties.description: National register of Historic places

properties.name: 1932/1980 Winter Olympic Museum
properties.description: The official Olympic museum for the 1932 and 1980 winter Olympics which features video clips, uniforms, equipment, medals, flags, a bobsled simulator, athlete profiles and photographs, and other memorabilia. Lake Placid is one of only three towns in the world to host two Olympic Winter Games

properties.name: ADK - Adirondack Mountain Club
properties.address: 1002 Adirondack Loj Road Lake Placid, NY 12946-0867
properties.description: Offers guided trips, outdoor workshops and skills courses all designed to help you explore the adirondack park to the fullest and promote education and safe outdoor recreation
properties.comments: There are multiple locations of ADK but the location given in the base for the educational department

properties.name: Pack Demonstration Forest, SUNY ESF
properties.description: DEC uses the property under agreement with SUNY ESF for research and training in the field of environmental studies
properties.comments: Open for 7 weeks of camp from late June through mid August

properties.name: Adirondack Folk School
properties.description: Folk Art Classes and Programs; gift shop

properties.name: Dannemora prison
properties.description: prison built in 1845 (AARCH Tour)

properties.name: Mt McGregor, Grant Cottage
properties.description: Arts and Crafts buildings - US Grant Cottage

properties.name: Westport Depot Theater
properties.address: 6705 Main Street (Westport Train Station) Westport, NY 12993
properties.description: working train station and art center

properties.name: Up Yonda Farm
properties.description: This 72 acre facility includes a museum featuring wildlife exhibits of native mammals & birds, nature programs, gardens, birding, honeybees, sugaring, woodworking, and hiking and snowshoe trails

properties.name: Penfield Homestead Museum and Ironville Historic District
properties.address: 703 Creek Rd, Historic Irnoville, Crown Point, 12928
properties.description: Known as the "Birthplace of the Electric Age," the hamlet of Ironville is the site of the first industrial application of electricity in the U.S. View a replica of the large electro magnet, now housed in the Smithsonian, which was purchased by Allen Penfield from its inventor Joseph Henry for use at the ironworks in 1831.

properties.name: Historic Bridges of the AuSable
properties.description: Seventeen Ausable River bridges are listed on the National Register, the first such group listing in New York State. Crossing the River: Historic Bridges of the AuSable River is an excellent guide and map, for taking a self-guided tour

properties.name: Adirondack History Center Museum
properties.address: Route 9N and Hand Avenue, Elizabethtown, NY

properties.name: Iron Center Museum
properties.description: Railroad and mining history exhibits are presented by the Town of Moriah Historical Society in a restored carriage house at the former Witherbee-Sherman and Company mining headquarters. Open June-October

properties.name: The War of 1812 Museum
properties.description: The Adirondack Coast of Lake Champlain was  one of the most important historic and military outposts of the War of 1812. The museum includes a permanent exhibit called Battle of Plattsburgh Interpretive Center.

properties.name: Philomena D Boat Tours
properties.description: Scenic two-hour narrated historical tours on Lake Champlain aboard the Philomena D, a converted 1948 50-foot Chesapeake fishing boat. Optional stop at the Lake Champlain Maritime Museum in Basin Harbor, VT. Special group rates and private charters.

properties.name: Fort Ticonderoga
properties.address: 30 Fort Ti Road Ticonderoga, New York 12883
properties.description: Restored war fort, offers daily programs, hands on activities, and exhibitions
properties.comments: General Admission mid May to mid October, programs and special events for rest of  year

properties.name: Valcour Island - Lake Champlain
properties.description: AARCH hiking tour of Revolutionary War naval battle

properties.name: John Brown Farm State Historic Site
properties.address: 115 John Brown Road Lake Placid, NY 12946

properties.name: Almanzo Wilder Homestead
properties.description: Boyhood home of Almanzo Wilder

properties.name: Cornell Maple Camp
properties.description: Teaches people how to produce maple products and also how to market it and be profitable
properties.comments: Only offered one weekend a year and is limited to 50 people
